Text:
I am using `(char.*?char2)` in order to extract subparts which starts with `char1` and which ends with `char2` from a string.

Now I want to extract temperature information e.g. (40 °C, 30°C, 80°F) from a string. In this case my regex expression should define the beginning character with any digit characters, and the ending with `°C` or `°F`, and there shouldn't be any letter in between, and it should also take `whitespace` character between the number and ending into possibility.

How can I define such a regex?

I have checked this, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11956793/regex-to-extract-temperatures-and-temperature-ranges-from-a-string, but the answer has slightly a different goal.

I am using `(char.*?char2)` in order to extract subparts which starts with `char1` and which ends with `char2` from a string.

Now I want to extract temperature information e.g. (40 °C, -30°C, 80°F) from a string. In this case my regex expression should define the beginning character with any digit characters by taking into the probability of `+` and `-`, and the ending with `°C` or `°F`, and there shouldn't be any letter in between, and it should also take `whitespace` character between the number and ending into possibility.

How can I define such a regex?

I have checked this, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11956793/regex-to-extract-temperatures-and-temperature-ranges-from-a-string, but the answer has slightly a different goal.

How can I define such a regex?

I have checked this, https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11956793/regex-to-extract-temperatures-and-temperature-ranges-from-a-string, but the answer has slightly a different goal.
